intro: Tristania micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy surface. Tristania micrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
